title: Proper formatting/coloring for compiler errors and warnings

body:
Also, there's an ongoing discussion about whether the compiler should also provide already colorized messages in Standard JSON: https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/issues/11507. These are mostly aimed at console tools though - for example colors would be represented using ANSI sequences and messages would still use whitespace for alignment. There are JS libs for converting ANSI sequences to HTML so I guess Remix could use it as a quick and dirty way to display prettier messages, but I think that reconstructing the message from components and making parts of it clickable/foldable is a better long-term solution.

If you think this would be useful to Remix though, feedback is welcome. Especially whether you think that ANSI sequences are a good way to do it.
